text.front:
High-pressure oxygen-induced bulk superconductivity
in 1222 structure
I
TI-Pb-Sr-Eu(Ce)-Cu-0
Z. lqbal
Allied-Signal Inc., Research and Technology,
Morrfsfown, New Jersey 07962
A. P. B. Sinha and D. E. Morris
Morris Research Inc.,
Berkeley, Califbrnid '94704
J. C. Barry and G. J. Auchterlonie
Electron Microscope Center, University of Queens&d,
Brisbane, Australia
B. L. Ramakrishna
Department of Chemistry, Arizona State University,
Tempe. Arizona 85287
( Received 4 March 1991; accepted for publication 4 May 1991
)
A primarily single phase compound of composition (T1c.sPbc.s ) Srz ( Euz _ &!e,) Cua09 (where
x ranges from (0.1 to 0.17) has been synthesized in the so-called 1222 structure. Bulk
superconductivity near 40 K is induced via oxygen doping in 100 bar of oxygen at 550 "C!. The
material has been structurally characterized by diffraction and high-resolution lattice
imaging techniques. The lattice images reveal the presence of some intergrowths of a 1212
structure nonsuperconducting (Tle,Pb&Sr2EuCu207
phase in the bulk 1222
structure of the parent compound and indications of periodicity that suggest the possible
existence of a new, composite structure 2434 phase.
